New Records: Clarke Schmidt set a record for the shortest postseason start in Yankees history, getting only eight outs over 2 ²/₃ innings.
Key Match Events: The game was a turning point for the Yankees, as a loss would end their season.
Schmidt's poor performance, including walks and a home run, were critical events in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were in a 2-0 series deficit, adding to the pressure on Clarke Schmidt.
Schmidt had high expectations as he was starting his third postseason game.
Post-Match Reflections: Clarke Schmidt expressed regret for not performing well when the team needed him most.
The loss put the Yankees' season on the brink of elimination.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article notes that the game was the first time the Yankees had faced a 2-0 series deficit in the World Series since 1996.
The Dodgers had been dominant with Freddie Freeman's performance in the series.
